result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

OTP canceled per email communication from Waukesha Co. defendant is sick and cannot be transported.  Attempted to contact both the State and Defense counsel about this.  State had no objection to canceling the OTP but never heard back from defense counsel.  Court will keep the 10/31 Hearing just to address scheduling and defendant will not be present.
filed, to be produced from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
filed, to be produced from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility

filed by Atty Angela Wang requesting status hearing come off of the calendar and a plea/sentencing date be set.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly - Approved**
Return of Notice of Assignment of Judge addressed to defendant.
For the 10/12/20222 Hearing for the defendant.  Return to sender, undeliverable as addressed, unable to forward.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court modified conditions of bail on the record, and defendant to sign new bond.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 07/25/2022:  Defendant is to follow all conditions of Department of Corrections while in residential treatment and to have no contact with the co-defendant when released from treatment.  Defendant to have no contact with victims/business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

10:18 AM Defendant Robert M Janzen appeared by Zoom from the Joshua Glover Treatment Center with attorney Angela Wang.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  The Court addresses Attorney Wang's motion to modify the bail conditions.  The State does not object to the modification of the bail conditions.  The Court granted the Motion to Modify Bail.  Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Modify Bond
